function.name: read_file
function.description: Read the entire content of a file at the given path.

path.description: Relative path from current working directory

function.name: write_file
function.description: Write or overwrite a file, creating parent directories if necessary.

function.name: create_directory
function.description: Create a directory (and parents if needed). Idempotent.

function.name: file_exists
function.description: Check whether a file or directory exists.

function.name: replace_in_file
function.description: Replace all exact matches of search string with replacement in the file.

function.name: search_text
function.description: Search for lines containing the pattern in files (grep-like).

pattern.description: Text or simple regex to search for

path.description: Directory or file to search in (default: .)

function.name: execute_shell_command
function.description: Execute one of the ALLOWED shell commands only (mostly cargo commands). Used for running tests, formatting, building, linting etc. Returns combined stdout + stderr.

command.description: The exact command to run (must start with one of the allowed prefixes)

function.name: git_status
function.description: Get the current git status (modified, staged, untracked, etc.)

function.name: git_diff
function.description: Show git diff for working directory or specific path

path.description: Optional: file or directory to diff

function.name: git_add
function.description: Stage file(s) or directory for commit (git add)

path.description: Path to add (or "." for all changes)

function.name: git_commit
function.description: Create a git commit with the provided message
